concept.title: Understanding Carburetor Operation
concept.shortdesc: The carburetor is an automatic float feed system that creates and controls the fuel-air mixture needed for engine operation.

section.title: Basic Function
section.p: The carburetor performs two key functions:

ul.li: Vaporizes gasoline by mixing it with air to create an explosive mixture
Controls the amount of this mixture delivered to the engine

section.title: Float Feed Mechanism
section.p: The automatic float mechanism maintains a constant gasoline level through a cycle of operations:

ol.li: Float pushes the inlet needle upward into its seat
Gasoline flow stops when needle seats
As gasoline level drops, float lowers
Lowered float allows needle to drop from seat

section.title: Mixture Control
section.p: Two key adjustments control the fuel mixture:

ul.li: The needle valve governs the quantity of gasoline in the mixture
The throttle controls the total volume of gas mixture entering the intake pipe, determining engine speed
